Beginner Mode
Flight speed and sensitivity will be substantially increased when you turn off Beginner mode. Fly with caution.
Beginner mode enabled. Altitude and distance will both be limited to 100ft / 30m.
Unit Mode Imperial Metric Imperial unit mode set successfully. Measurement values will now follow imperial unit system. Since the aircraft supports metric unit system, the values seen are approximate conversions. Example: 10m ≈ 32ft - 34ft

Take Off? Ensure that conditions are safe for takeoff. Aircraft will go to an altitude of %1$s and hover. Positioning failed. The aircraft will automatically fly to %1$s above the ground. Do not take off in a narrow space or near crowd or buildings. Do not touch propellers. Precisely record takeoff point With Precision Takeoff Mode enabled, the aircraft will automatically ascend to %1$s. This allows the aircraft to return to home point more accurately with VPS images. Ensure there is sufficient ambient light and that the takeoff route isn\'t blocked by trees, power lines or other objects. Moving the sticks during takeoff may affect image acquisition. In an emergency, use the control sticks to throttle downward. Slide to Take Off
Land? Aircraft will land at its current location. Check landing area is clear. Slide to Land
Continue Landing? Aircraft has descended to %1$s. Aircraft is hovering low. Ensure the landing point is safe and push the stick downward to land.
Not suitable for landing. Area is not suitable for landing. Please move to a safer location. Slide to Force Landing
Return home and land? Slide to Return Home The distance between the aircraft and Home Point is less than 65.6 ft (20 m). The aircraft will return home at its current altitude if RTH is initiated. The aircraft is less than 20 m (65.6 ft) from the Home Point. The aircraft will land if Return to Home is initiated. Approaching a No-Fly Zone. Current RTH route may be distorted. Monitor the aircraft\'s flight path on the map or visually to ensure safety. Aircraft will head to home point and set RTH route. Use virtual joystick to adjust flight direction. Tap Cancel RTH button to stop RTH. Aircraft will adjust its nose direction to face the home point, and its altitude to %1$s. Current aircraft altitude is %2$s. Press Return to Home button directly on your remote to cancel this procedure, or take over control sticks.
Antenna 1 Antenna 2 Base Station Satellites# GPS: BeiDou: GLONASS: Galileo:
Aircraft Base Station Latitude: %1$.9f %1$.3f %1$.2f Longitude: Ellipsoidal Height: Course Angle: Orientation: Positioning: Standard Deviation: Real-Time Kinematic positioning is based on the phase of the signal\'s carrier phase and outputs centimeter-level 3D positioning on particular coordinates. Heading is determined by the two antennas of the rover.
RTK Positioning When RTK module malfunctions, manually disable RTK and switch back to GPS mode. (If you enable RTK after takeoff, the GPS will continually be used.) Motors are running. Stop them and try again.

Maintain Positioning Accuracy Mode In case of an RTK module communication error, the aircraft will automatically maintain the current RTK status with gradually decreasing accuracy. The aircraft will exit RTK if the connection is not re-established within 10 minutes.
Unlock Unlock %1$s By tapping Unlock, you agree that you have the authorization to operate in this fly zone. A record of this request will be linked to your DJI account. Tap Cancel to abort the operation. Currently unlocked and expires at %1$s Failed to unlock. You are not authorized to unlock this zone. Failed to unlock. %1$s Failed to login. You are not authorized to perform this action. Something went wrong. Failed to login. Please try again later. Warning Enhanced warning Authorized Restricted Self Unlock Custom Unlock In order to unlock fly zones you must login with your DJI account. Tap Log in to continue logging in Custom Unlock on Aircraft Custom Unlock Enabled %1$s is currently enabled. Do you wish you disable it and enable %2$s

Check the following Retry No D-RTK 2 Mobile Stations found 1. Check whether the D-RTK 2 Mobile Station is powered on\n2. Ensure the D-RTK 2 Mobile Station is placed in an open area free of obstructions\n3. Check whether the D-RTK 2 Mobile Station is set in Broadcast mode View D-RTK 2 connection guide Connection failed Request failed. Check and try again
Reset Password Power On Switch Modes Connect to DJI Pilot Press and hold the linking button for 3 seconds while pressing the M button simultaneously. The indicator will blink red several times to indicate that the password has been reset to 123456 Press and hold the power button for 3 seconds. The indicator will display solid green to indicate initialization is complete Press and hold the operating mode button for two seconds until the indicator blinks yellow. Then, press the same button to switch mobile station modes. Go to RTK Settings and select the current D-RTK 2 mobile station. Linking is now complete The device automatically restarts after switching to and from Broadcast mode. Restarting takes around 10s Back Next Complete Replay Reset Success Tap to switch modes Broadcast mode is indicated by the indicator blinking five times in a row
